intro: Rubus moldavicus, commonly known as the Moldavian blackberry, is a species of bramble native to the Carpathian Mountains. It is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, aggregate fruits that are typically dark purple to black in color. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in woodland areas or along forest edges. Botanically, it belongs to the Rosaceae family, which includes other well-known fruit-bearing plants.
